claim: Recombinant HA antigens produced using BEVS have been shown to induce significantly higher levels of broadly cross-reactive antibodies against highly conserved regions of HA compared with egg-derived vaccines.

rejected_evidence.quote: Expression of proteins in insect cells using recombinant baculovirus expression system has been shown to result in the production of hemagglutinin (HA) antigens that are structurally and antigenically similar to those derived from influenza viruses grown in eggs, but with the potential for improved immunogenicity, including the induction of broadly cross-reactive antibodies against highly conserved regions of HA [7,8].
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This quote explicitly states that recombinant HA antigens produced using the baculovirus expression system (BEVS) have the potential for improved immunogenicity, specifically mentioning the induction of broadly cross-reactive antibodies against highly conserved regions of HA, directly supporting the claim.
